constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 132 (Wednesday, July 28, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Ms. CLARK of Massachusetts:
H.R. 4751.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
This bill is enacted pursuant to the power granted to
Congress under Article I, Section 8, Clause 3 of the United
States Constitution.
By Mr. Crow
H.R. 4752.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
to regulate commerce with foreign nations, and among the
several states, and with the Indian tribes.
[Page H4250]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

title: Exposing Discrimination in Higher Education Act
